DOC.detailed_description: This prospective study aim investigate effectiveness safety patient neurogenic claudication diagnose lumbar stenosis lumbar MRI receive integrative Korean medicine treatment ( herbal medicine , Chuna manipulation , bee venom pharmacopuncture pharmacopuncture , acupuncture , electroacupuncture , cup ) 3 location Jaseng Hospital Korean Medicine ( Bucheon , Daejeon , Busan ( Haeundae ) ) assessment pain , functional disability , quality life 1-year follow-up period
DOC.criteria: Patients radiate leg pain without low back pain ( LBP ) ( walk pain NRS ≥4 ) Patients dural sac crosssectional area ( DSCA ) < 100 mm2 morphological grading ≥B assess MRI Patients clear neurogenic claudication symptom ( symptom aggravate walking , alleviate upon rest lumbar flexion position ) Patients receive surgery recommendation lumbar spinal stenosis Patients plan receiving Korean medicine treatment lumbar spinal stenosis ≥2 month Patients agree study participation Patients vascular claudication Patients systemic disease may interfere treatment effect outcome interpretation Patients soft tissue pathology pathologies nonspinal origin may cause LBP radiate leg pain ( e.g . spinal tumor , rheumatoid arthritis ) Patients acupuncture treatment may inappropriate unsafe ( e.g . hemorrhagic disease , blood clotting disorder , history anticoagulation medicine intake , serious diabetes risk infection , severe cardiovascular disease , condition deem unsuitable acupuncture treatment ) Pregnant patient patient plan pregnancy Patients serious psychological disorder Patients unable fill study participation consent form Subjects deem unsuitable study participation assess researcher
